snippet.textDisplay:
Arlecchino's questline was creepy in the base game due to his voice acting.

In this DLC (especially because of the audio logs and Rose Estate location) he was genuinely terrifying.
snippet.textOriginal:
Arlecchino's questline was creepy in the base game due to his voice acting.

In this DLC (especially because of the audio logs and Rose Estate location) he was genuinely terrifying.

snippet.textDisplay: I tried to beat him alone for a couple of hours but I didn't want another "Radahn situation". So I used lea.
snippet.textOriginal: I tried to beat him alone for a couple of hours but I didn't want another "Radahn situation". So I used lea.

snippet.textDisplay: On NG+3 (where I fought him) it takes like 2-3 hits of his multi hit combo to kill me. Facetanking like a lot of these streamers is a big no-no lol. One of the hardest bosses, did him first with Lea (still hard on NG+3) cause there was dialogue and the combined critical attack is soooo fking sick. Afterwards I did him solo in boss rush mode. Also this voice actor is insane. I loved him in base game already, glad we got him back with the DLC.

snippet.textDisplay:
As far as I know, Arlecchino is the only boss in the entire game that reacts to you healing.

If you try and heal during a window his eyes flash red and he adds more to his combo. This dude is bloodthirsty, which is appropriate.
snippet.textOriginal:
As far as I know, Arlecchino is the only boss in the entire game that reacts to you healing.

If you try and heal during a window his eyes flash red and he adds more to his combo. This dude is bloodthirsty, which is appropriate.

snippet.textDisplay: This boss is insane. The way he mixes up different parts of different combos with each other is what makes him so difficult. He tests my reaction time more than any other boss because of that one aspect of the fight. Also I love the flash when his eyes glow red and he attacks immediately, that's the game telling you that he's doing input reading. And that's why sometimes his combos seem endless. Because he finishes a combo, then when he reads your input and sees that you're trying to heal, his eyes glow red and he follows up with another combo immediately
snippet.textOriginal: This boss is insane. The way he mixes up different parts of different combos with each other is what makes him so difficult. He tests my reaction time more than any other boss because of that one aspect of the fight. Also I love the flash when his eyes glow red and he attacks immediately, that's the game telling you that he's doing input reading. And that's why sometimes his combos seem endless. Because he finishes a combo, then when he reads your input and sees that you're trying to heal, his eyes glow red and he follows up with another combo immediately
